intro: Psychotria ramosii, commonly known as the "Coca plant" or "Yareta," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine conditions. Psychotria ramosii is notable for its medicinal properties and has been traditionally used by indigenous communities for various purposes.
